posts.title: Budget-Friendly Activities for Spring Break in Arkansas
posts.content:
If you aren't traveling anywhere for Spring Break this week, the Natural State offers families plenty of budget-friendly activities to enjoy close to home. Get your kids away from the screens and out into the great outdoors with these fun ideas.

  • Wild & Free: Spend a day birdwatching or exploring Arkansas' 1800+ miles of public hiking trails. You can also hop on a bike and explore local bike trails or paths.
  • Educational & Entertaining: Visit one of the many free or paid museums, visit a historic theater, or take to the stars on a camping adventure.

Check out the full guide from Only in Arkansas here.

posts.title: CRISP & GREEN Announces Opening of First Arkansas Location in Bentonville
posts.content:
Healthy, fast-casual restaurant, CRISP & GREEN, is set to open its first Arkansas location in Bentonville this April. Founded in 2016, The restaurant serves up nutritious and delicious bowls, salads, smoothies, and more, made with sustainably and consciously sourced ingredients.

  • Committed to community: In addition to great food, the restaurant partners with local fitness experts to provide complimentary classes and looks forward to becoming an integral part of Bentonville's health-conscious and active community.
  • Rapid expansion: Encouraged by growing consumer demand for healthy and convenient food options, CRISP & GREEN is planning five locations across Arkansas and is on track to double its presence, with locations in 15 states in 2023.

Keep up with the new location here.

posts.title: Razorbacks Clinch Sweet 16 Bid with Victory Over 1 Seed Kansas
posts.content:
The Arkansas Razorbacks advanced to the programâ€™s 14th Sweet 16 with a win over Kansas on Saturday, despite being down 12 points in the second half. Devo Davis was instrumental in the comeback, scoring 25 points, and Ricky Council IV sealed the victory with his last five points from the line.

  • No. 1 seed? No problem: This is the third year in a row Arkansas has faced a top-seeded team, bringing their record to 2-1 in these matchups in that timeframe. In the 2022 Sweet 16, the Razorbacks upset Gonzaga and cut Kansas' dance short in the second round of the 2021 tourney.
  • 6th man: Jordan Walsh came off the bench and went for 10 points and three rebounds. Kamani Johnson also had 10 boards and a putback late.

Relive the epic win here and watch Musselman show off his muscles here.

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Has Something for Everyone This Spring Break
posts.content:
Crystal Bridges has something for everyone this Spring Break! Explore 120 acres of Ozark forest, with trails, galleries, art classes, and more.

  • Party on: Spring Break week kicked off with Pintura Fest this past Saturday, which included family-friendly activities, live painting, performances, and more.
  • There's more: With the opening party out of the way, there's still more fun to be had the rest of the week. You'll be able to explore Diego Rivera's vision of America, enjoy live performances, go through an obstacle course, learn from artist demos, and more!

Learn more about the museum here.

posts.title: Go Into the Jungle in NWA Through The Jungle Book Collaborative Performance
posts.content:
Experience the strength of the jungle in The Jungle Book, a collaboration between Trike Theatre, Ra-Ve Cultural Foundation, and Megha Rao of Dhirana Dance for an original adaptation of the beloved tale.

  • Perfect mixture: Mixing theatrical storytelling with classical Indian dance, The Jungle Book follows Mowgli's journey to trust her community instead of going alone.
  • Local talent: Featuring talented youth actors and dancers from across NWA, this engaging performance combines professional production, local talent, and an all-time favorite fable.

Mark your calendars for Mar 25 at 4pm, and get your tickets here.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• March madness: #MarchMadness Hip Hop & R&B Concert is happening at the Arkansas Event Center this Sat Mar 25 with singers, DJs, food, giveaways, and fun. Get more info and grab your tickets HERE.*
  • Tax time: Fayetteville Public Library is hosting a tax assistance program Tue Mar 21, providing qualified participants free, quality tax preparation services.*
  • Top 10: Eureka Springs placed 7th on the USA Today Best Southern Towns list.
  • Printing money: The U of A was awarded a $3.5m grant from Applied Research Associates to research 3D concrete printing techniques.
  • Another one: NWA made CNBC's list of top 10 cities to buy a home with relatively healthy rent affordability and much higher than average population growth.
  • Getting to know you: We're trying to learn more about our audience to serve you better. To do this, we're conducting an anonymous survey, and we would LOVE for you to help us by filling it out!
